contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=November 2009}} During the [[Iraq War]], '''Operation Sweeny''' was a counter-smuggling sweep of the [[Al Faw Peninsula]] and nearby waters conducted beginning on 15 October 2003. Elements of the [[13th Marine Expeditionary Unit]], operating from the [[USS Peleliu]], used small boats and landed units to capture a number of persons, boats and trucks smuggling fuel out of Iraq. Followed [[Operation Chamberlain]], followed by [[Operation OK Corral]] {{Portal box|Iraq}} {{2003 Operations}} {{Iraq War}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sweeny}} [[Category:Military operations of the Iraq War involving the United States]] [[Category:Military operations of the Iraq War in 2003]] [[Category:Smuggling]] [[Category:United States Marine Corps in the Iraq War]] {{USMC-stub}} {{Iraq-hist-stub}}
